title: Calories in a Fried Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in an egg fried, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per egg, and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in non-stick pan with 1 tsp oil absorbed; sunny-side up, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fat amount, cooking method, and brand; values approximate. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried with 1 tsp butter instead of oil
Add 1 slice American cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in an egg fried?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg with minimal oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.3 g protein per large fried egg.

faqs.q: How does a fried egg compare to a boiled egg in calories?
faqs.a: A fried egg has ~92 kcal vs. ~78 kcal for boiled, due to added cooking fat.

faqs.q: Are fried eggs high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 7 g total fat per egg, mostly from the yolk and cooking oil.

faqs.q: Does the amount of oil affect calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”minimal oil adds ~14 kcal; 1 tbsp oil can add up to 120 kcal extra.
